intro: Peristylus unguiculatus, commonly known as the hooked peristylus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Peristylus unguiculatus is typically found in moist, sandy soils in open woodlands and along stream banks.
